name: I-Residence Hotel Silom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located next to the Skytrain Chong Nonsi station, this hotel has decent rooms and an excellent pool on the roof - essential to survive the summer heat. The breakfast was correct and the staff, just average, with one woman being borderline rude, although most others were polite and attentive.
reviews.title: Perfect base to explore the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We got here last minute: our reservation was with next-door The Heritage Silom, but due to the pool being closed for renovations we decided to change. They were nice enough not to charge us a penalty.
reviews.title: I called for Manager and realized the staff wasn't the mistake--the manager was!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we were dining there the staff kept coming over to the table and trying to clear everything away--even when we said No they said Yes and tried to take something else. We got another person to serve us and same problem. So finally I called Restaurant Manager...and he started trying to do it too!! I was there a few months earlier and it looked like they had some high staff turnover and restaurant area very poor training. The breakfast is good, location is fantastic and fun area, the biggest concern is the size of the rooms...you almost fall into the bathroom from the door and bed and window. Nice looking yet very confining. If you are small and by yourself...not too bad. If you are couple or sharing a room might be too small.
reviews.title: one min to bts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room is small but the bed and pillow is comfortable,the bath room is really small and not so clean,check i must give dep even pay full amount.
reviews.title: Choosen this hotel because nearer to tailoring at silom road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned this bangkok trip especially for tailoring my 2 tuxedo for my wedding dinner & ceremony, so I choosen this hotel as it is convenient to silom road and also near the BTS station Chong Nonsi.
reviews.title: FORGET THIS HOTEL: THEY ARE LIERS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good things first
reviews.title: Great Room Design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: 1. Location right next to the BTS station was good.
reviews.title: can do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The Grand Deluxe Room was spacious, chic, cosy and new. Loved the colour combination of black carpet and red feature wall behind the bed. And the white wooden shutter in the bathroom seen through the big glass window. You can see that the furniture weren't luxurious, but the design was done really well.
reviews.title: I loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Check-in and out was fast.
reviews.title: Great location - great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. The roof top swimming pool area was pretty.
reviews.title: Excellent price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of the general positive reviews over here at TripAdvisor!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was definitely a great move!!
reviews.title: Great location & Comfortable room!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It was quite a pleasant and enjoyable stay. Initially, I had booked the normal deluxe room but decided to upgrade to the Grand Deluxe room at the reception as it was only around $25 extra per night. And, the receptionist was nice enough to get one of the staffs to bring us up to room to take a look first before confirming. The room was indeed spacious and looked exactly as what it was shown on the website and other travellers' pictures.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel and friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staffs were friendly and they are often very helpful to advise us where and how to go to the various attractions and quoted us the estimated taxi charges to whichever places (prevent us from getting conned).
reviews.title: Couldnt wait to leave - Id really suggest reconsidering booking here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just opposite of the BTS Chong Nonsi Station. Once you have alighted from the train at the platform, you will be able to see the hotel. We will definitely stay there again should we be going to BKK again!
reviews.title: Nice hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked into I-Residence from 13th- 15th Sep'11 after our trip to Hua Hin. Chose this hotel based on location at Silom & PatPhong. Reception area was too small, seems crowded always. Price wise mid range after including agency fees and taxes cost almost THB2000 per nite.
reviews.title: Convenient location just 5 mins away from BTS Chong Nongsi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Information on website was misleading, only free internet available at the business centre with only 2 computers. WiFi and LAN were chargeable for room usage.
reviews.title: Interesting experience.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was sufficient, located on the 10th floor same level as the swimming pool. You can view people using the BTS in the morning. Pool was nice, more of a lap pool overlooking the BTS.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms were basic, looks nice in photographs but in detail cheap furnishing. Toilets were small, you will need to place your toiletries on shelf in room not toilet.
reviews.title: you get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My preference of location staying in Bangkok would have been the Riverside area. It's busy but not too crowded. You can always hop onto the shuttle boats or ferry to crossover to Saphan Taksin BTS to move around central Bangkok.
reviews.title: A Place to Avoid

description: A comfortable boutique hotel in Bangkok with a location that will please the tourist and the businessman, just steps from public transportation. Situated between Silom and Sathorn district, adjacent to BTS Chong Nonsi Station surrounded by business area and shopping attractions, i-Residence Silom Bangkok Hotel provides a full range of facilities, 24 hour services as well as a trustworthy security system.
